data:
1
00:01:51,809 --> 00:01:53,630
Bingo!

2
00:01:54,500 --> 00:01:56,680
(chimps screeching)

3
00:02:07,943 --> 00:02:09,814
Fucking hell.

4
00:02:09,904 --> 00:02:11,554
(screech)

5
00:02:12,074 --> 00:02:14,035
Fucking hell.

6
00:03:04,178 --> 00:03:06,869
- Oh, God...
- Keep your shit together.

7
00:03:06,919 --> 00:03:10,000
lf you wanna get 'em out of here.

8
00:03:10,870 --> 00:03:13,520
- l can pop these, no problem.
- So get to it!

9
00:03:27,744 --> 00:03:30,225
Security, we have a break-in. Get the...

10
00:03:38,707 --> 00:03:41,528
l know who you are.
l know what you think...

11
00:03:41,618 --> 00:03:45,449
lf you don't wanna get hurt,
keep your mouth shut and don't move.

12
00:03:45,579 --> 00:03:50,790
The chimps are infected. They're highly
contagious. They've been given an inhibitor.

13
00:03:50,880 --> 00:03:54,361
- lnfected with what?
- To cure, you must first understand.

14
00:03:54,451 --> 00:03:57,402
lnfected with what?

15
00:03:59,362 --> 00:04:01,233
Rage.

16
00:04:02,933 --> 00:04:06,104
- What is he talking about?
- Get the cages open.

17
00:04:06,194 --> 00:04:07,535
No! No! No!

18
00:04:08,235 --> 00:04:12,536
Listen, you sick bastard,
we're taking your torture victims with us.

19
00:04:12,626 --> 00:04:14,196
We'll get you out of here.

20
00:04:14,276 --> 00:04:18,978
The animals are contagious. The infection
is in their blood and saliva. One bite...

21
00:04:19,068 --> 00:04:21,538
Stop... Stop! You've no idea!

22
00:04:24,149 --> 00:04:26,019
(screaming)

23
00:04:28,110 --> 00:04:30,941
Get it off! Help me!

24
00:04:36,332 --> 00:04:38,463
Get it off! Get it off!

25
00:04:42,074 --> 00:04:45,284
- What's the matter with her?
- You have to kill her!

26
00:04:47,375 --> 00:04:49,596
(screams) Oh, my God!

27
00:04:53,947 --> 00:04:57,158
- What's the matter with her?
- We have to kill her now!

28
00:04:59,678 --> 00:05:01,249
Oh, God...

29
00:05:01,809 --> 00:05:02,809
(screaming)

30
00:05:39,689 --> 00:05:41,689
(sharp intake of breath)

31
00:06:50,237 --> 00:06:51,757
Hello?

32
00:07:08,842 --> 00:07:10,152
(coughs)

33
00:07:30,197 --> 00:07:31,678
Hello?

34
00:07:49,853 --> 00:07:51,853
(louder) Hello!

35
00:08:22,861 --> 00:08:23,951
(belches)

36
00:09:33,800 --> 00:09:35,100
Hello?

37
00:10:01,417 --> 00:10:02,937
Hello!

38
00:11:57,967 --> 00:11:59,968
(alarm)

39
00:14:55,274 --> 00:14:57,364
Hello?

40
00:15:05,366 --> 00:15:07,447
Hello?

41
00:15:09,277 --> 00:15:11,758
(noises from behind door)

42
00:15:17,929 --> 00:15:20,280
(gasping and retching)

43
00:15:21,800 --> 00:15:23,891
Father?

44
00:15:30,323 --> 00:15:32,373
Father, are you OK?

45
00:15:39,715 --> 00:15:42,416
Oh, shouldn't have done that.

46
00:15:42,806 --> 00:15:45,067
Shouldn't have done that.

47
00:15:45,507 --> 00:15:47,377
Shit!

48
00:16:14,164 --> 00:16:16,255
(man) Over here!

49
00:16:19,165 --> 00:16:21,466
- Over here!
- Come on!

50
00:16:33,949 --> 00:16:36,430
Go, go, go!

51
00:16:41,691 --> 00:16:42,732
Keep going!

52
00:16:42,822 --> 00:16:45,692
- What the fuck is going on?
- Just shut up!

53
00:16:53,865 --> 00:16:56,435
- Covered everything.
- Who are those people?

54
00:17:23,742 --> 00:17:25,003
Let's go! Let's go!

55
00:17:25,093 --> 00:17:27,313
- What the fuck is going on?
- Just move!

56
00:17:36,146 --> 00:17:38,146
Come on!

57
00:17:57,321 --> 00:18:02,062
Man walks into a bar with a giraffe.
They each get pissed.

58
00:18:02,152 --> 00:18:04,153
The giraffe falls over.

59
00:18:04,233 --> 00:18:09,454
The man goes to leave and the barman says
''Oi! You can't leave that lying there.''

60
00:18:09,544 --> 00:18:13,585
He says ''No, it's not a lion. lt's a giraffe''.

61
00:18:21,237 --> 00:18:24,108
He's completely humourless.

62
00:18:24,198 --> 00:18:27,109
You two should get on like a house on fire.

63
00:18:28,629 --> 00:18:30,680
So who are you?

64
00:18:31,890 --> 00:18:33,811
You're from the hospital.

65
00:18:33,891 --> 00:18:37,422
- Are you a doctor?
- He's not a doctor. He's a patient.

66
00:18:37,502 --> 00:18:39,812
l'm a bicycle courier.

67
00:18:41,983 --> 00:18:48,424
l was riding a package from Farringdon to
Shaftesbury Avenue and a car cut across me.

68
00:18:48,504 --> 00:18:52,245
Then l wake up today in hospital.
l wake up and l'm...

69
00:18:52,335 --> 00:18:54,246
l'm hallucinating or l'm...

70
00:18:55,946 --> 00:18:58,377
What's your name?

71
00:18:58,467 --> 00:19:00,558
Jim.

72
00:19:01,208 --> 00:19:03,898
l'm Mark. This is Selena.

73
00:19:08,340 --> 00:19:09,990
OK, Jim.

74
00:19:15,812 --> 00:19:18,332
l've got some bad news.

75
00:19:18,422 --> 00:19:24,684
lt started as rioting, and right from
the beginning you knew this was different.

76
00:19:24,774 --> 00:19:28,945
Because it was happening
in small villages, market towns.

77
00:19:29,815 --> 00:19:32,556
And then it wasn't on the TV any more.

78
00:19:32,636 --> 00:19:37,377
lt was in the street outside.
lt was coming through your windows.

79
00:19:37,467 --> 00:19:39,298
lt was a virus.

80
00:19:39,378 --> 00:19:41,168
An infection.

81
00:19:41,248 --> 00:19:44,079
You didn't need a doctor to tell you that.

82
00:19:44,169 --> 00:19:46,600
lt was the blood.

83
00:19:46,690 --> 00:19:49,210
There was something in the blood.

84
00:19:50,691 --> 00:19:55,642
By the time they tried to evacuate
the cities, it was already too late.

85
00:19:55,732 --> 00:19:58,643
The infection was everywhere.

86
00:19:58,733 --> 00:20:01,213
The army blockades were overrun.

87
00:20:02,784 --> 00:20:05,474
And that's when the exodus started.

88
00:20:06,865 --> 00:20:09,606
The day before broadcasting stopped,

89
00:20:09,696 --> 00:20:13,347
there were reports of lnfection
in Paris and New York.

90
00:20:15,737 --> 00:20:18,648
We didn't hear anything more after that.

91
00:20:21,609 --> 00:20:24,569
- What's the government doing?
- There's no government.

92
00:20:24,649 --> 00:20:27,130
Of course there's a government!

93
00:20:27,220 --> 00:20:31,261
There's always a government.
They're in a bunker or a plane...

94
00:20:31,391 --> 00:20:35,652
No, there's no government,
no police, no army.

95
00:20:37,133 --> 00:20:40,224
No TV, no radio, no electricity.

96
00:20:40,834 --> 00:20:45,005
You're the first uninfected person
we've seen in six days.

97
00:20:45,835 --> 00:20:47,926
Where's your family?

98
00:20:48,836 --> 00:20:50,876
They're dead. Like Selena's.

99
00:20:50,966 --> 00:20:53,097
Yours will be dead too.

100
00:21:03,400 --> 00:21:07,401
Look, l have to find them.
They live in Deptford. l can walk it. OK?

101
00:21:07,491 --> 00:21:10,061
You'll go and come back, yeah?

102
00:21:12,062 --> 00:21:14,272
- You won't.
- Yes!

103
00:21:14,362 --> 00:21:17,363
No one ever comes back.

104
00:21:21,884 --> 00:21:23,975
So lesson one.

105
00:21:24,845 --> 00:21:29,276
You never go anywhere alone
unless you've got no choice.

106
00:21:29,366 --> 00:21:31,667
Lesson two.

107
00:21:31,757 --> 00:21:35,848
Only travel during daylight.
Unless you've got no choice.

108
00:21:37,889 --> 00:21:39,939
We'll take you tomorrow.

109
00:21:40,019 --> 00:21:43,630
We'll all go and find
your dead parents together, OK?

110
00:21:44,670 --> 00:21:46,111
Eat.

111
00:21:58,284 --> 00:22:01,465
lf you want her to slow down,
you'll have to say.

112
00:22:28,382 --> 00:22:30,032
- lf there's anyone...
- l understand.

113
00:22:30,122 --> 00:22:32,213
- Anyone...
- l understand!

114
00:22:34,343 --> 00:22:35,864
OK.

115
00:23:09,262 --> 00:23:11,223
(sniffs)

116
00:23:17,655 --> 00:23:19,005
Jim...

117
00:23:19,835 --> 00:23:21,176
Wait!

118
00:24:45,858 --> 00:24:49,809
They died peacefully.
You should be grateful.

119
00:24:49,899 --> 00:24:52,289
l'm not grateful.

120
00:24:53,550 --> 00:24:55,550
My...

121
00:24:56,250 --> 00:25:00,772
parents and my sister,
we went to Paddington Station,

122
00:25:03,382 --> 00:25:08,724
hoping maybe we could get on a plane,
maybe we could buy our way onto a plane.

123
00:25:09,384 --> 00:25:11,724
l remember my dad had all this cash,

124
00:25:11,814 --> 00:25:15,165
even though cash was completely useless.

125
00:25:16,686 --> 00:25:19,817
About 20,000 other people had the same idea.

126
00:25:22,337 --> 00:25:24,558
Crowd was surging.

127
00:25:25,388 --> 00:25:27,689
l lost my grip on my sister's hand.

128
00:25:29,869 --> 00:25:32,210
l remember the ground was soft.

129
00:25:34,170 --> 00:25:38,561
l looked down
and l was standing on all these people.

130
00:25:38,651 --> 00:25:42,602
Like a carpet. People who had fallen and...

131
00:25:42,692 --> 00:25:46,654
Somewhere in the crowd
there were lnfected. lt spread fast.

132
00:25:46,734 --> 00:25:50,084
No one could run.
All you could do was climb.

133
00:25:51,695 --> 00:25:54,786
Climb over more people.
So l did that. l climbed.

134
00:25:54,876 --> 00:25:57,216
And l got up on top of this kiosk.

135
00:25:59,527 --> 00:26:04,478
Looking down, you couldn't tell
which faces were infected and which weren't.

136
00:26:04,568 --> 00:26:08,439
Then l saw my dad.
Not my mum or my sister.

137
00:26:08,569 --> 00:26:10,530
My dad.

138
00:26:12,790 --> 00:26:14,881
His face...

139
00:26:18,572 --> 00:26:22,483
Selena's right.
You should be grateful.

140
00:26:22,573 --> 00:26:27,704
We don't have time to get back to the shop
before dark. We should stay here tonight.

141
00:26:30,405 --> 00:26:33,226
My room's up at the top.
You two can have that.

142
00:26:33,316 --> 00:26:36,667
No, we'll all sleep in the same room. lt's safer.

143
00:27:51,166 --> 00:27:53,507
(radio)

144
00:27:56,947 --> 00:27:59,038
Jim.

145
00:28:07,730 --> 00:28:09,771
- You're back.
- Yeah.

146
00:28:16,173 --> 00:28:18,253
- How was it?
- Fine.

147
00:28:19,343 --> 00:28:21,644
Give me a drink of that, will ya?

148
00:28:21,734 --> 00:28:23,774
- lt's empty.
- Ha!

149
00:28:26,085 --> 00:28:28,436
Here.

150
00:28:30,516 --> 00:28:32,607
l'll start working on them, then.

151
00:28:39,259 --> 00:28:41,219
Mark! Mark!

152
00:28:42,049 --> 00:28:44,180
Selena! Help!

153
00:28:58,524 --> 00:29:00,574
(Selena) lt's clear.

154
00:29:06,056 --> 00:29:09,006
- That's Mr Bridges.
- Were you bitten?

155
00:29:09,096 --> 00:29:11,317
And his daughter. From four doors down.

156
00:29:11,397 --> 00:29:14,488
- Were you bitten?
- No.

157
00:29:14,578 --> 00:29:17,489
Did any of the blood get in your mouth?

158
00:29:18,399 --> 00:29:20,399
No.

159
00:29:23,530 --> 00:29:25,271
Mark?

160
00:29:27,711 --> 00:29:29,402
Wait...

161
00:29:31,402 --> 00:29:33,793
(Mark screams)

162
00:29:51,277 --> 00:29:53,498
Get that cleaned off.

163
00:29:55,368 --> 00:29:57,459
Do you have any clothes here?

164
00:29:58,589 --> 00:30:00,460
Um... l... Yes.

165
00:30:00,540 --> 00:30:04,201
Then get them and get dressed.
We have to leave now.

166
00:30:04,281 --> 00:30:07,942
More lnfected will be coming.
They always do.

167
00:30:36,729 --> 00:30:39,730
(Jim) How did you know?
How did you know he was infected?

168
00:30:39,810 --> 00:30:43,731
- The blood.
- There was blood on me. lt was on you.

169
00:30:43,811 --> 00:30:49,212
l didn't know he was infected.
He knew. l could see it in his face.

170
00:30:49,292 --> 00:30:53,684
lf someone gets infected,
you've about 20 seconds to kill them.

171
00:30:53,774 --> 00:30:58,905
lt might be your brother, your sister
or your oldest friend. lt makes no difference.

172
00:30:58,995 --> 00:31:04,426
Just so you know where you stand,
if it happens to you, l'll do it in a heartbeat.

173
00:31:04,516 --> 00:31:08,738
He was full of plans.
Have you got any plans, Jim?

174
00:31:08,818 --> 00:31:13,259
Do you want us to find a cure and
save the world orjust fall in love and fuck?

175
00:31:13,349 --> 00:31:15,869
Plans are pointless.

176
00:31:15,959 --> 00:31:18,520
Staying alive's as good as it gets.

177
00:31:20,351 --> 00:31:21,781
Hey, hey, hey, hey.

178
00:31:21,871 --> 00:31:23,962
What's that?

179
00:31:30,043 --> 00:31:32,134
Let's go.

180
00:32:17,275 --> 00:32:20,366
What is it about tower blocks
and shopping trolleys?

181
00:32:20,446 --> 00:32:23,537
Stop talking. lt's a long way up.

182
00:32:33,280 --> 00:32:35,580
(Selena) Do you need a break?

183
00:32:36,801 --> 00:32:38,801
- You?
- No.

184
00:32:41,502 --> 00:32:43,542
Now l do need a break.

185
00:32:54,025 --> 00:32:55,845
What's up?

186
00:32:55,986 --> 00:32:57,936
Nothin'.

187
00:33:00,327 --> 00:33:01,677
l got a headache.

188
00:33:01,767 --> 00:33:03,247
- Bad?
- Pretty bad.

189
00:33:03,327 --> 00:33:08,639
- Why didn't you say something before?
- l didn't think you'd give a shit.

190
00:33:09,849 --> 00:33:14,120
You've got no fat on you
and all you've had to eat is sugar.

191
00:33:14,200 --> 00:33:16,291
So you're crashing.

192
00:33:16,381 --> 00:33:18,641
There isn't a lot we can do about that

193
00:33:18,721 --> 00:33:23,813
except pump you full of painkillers
and give you more sugar. As for sugar,

194
00:33:23,903 --> 00:33:26,203
Pepsi or Lilt?

195
00:33:27,464 --> 00:33:29,424
Do you have any Tango?

196
00:33:29,554 --> 00:33:32,555
Actually,
l did have a can of Tango somewhere.

197
00:33:32,645 --> 00:33:33,685
(screech)

198
00:33:33,775 --> 00:33:36,036
Quiet! That's an lnfected.

199
00:33:46,389 --> 00:33:48,209
Oh no, they're in. Move!

200
00:33:51,300 --> 00:33:53,861
Wait up, Selena!

201
00:33:54,781 --> 00:33:56,781
Wait for me, please!

202
00:33:56,861 --> 00:33:59,002
Please, Selena! Please!

203
00:33:59,082 --> 00:34:01,393
- Wait for me!
- Come on!

204
00:34:01,473 --> 00:34:03,473
- Run!
- Wait!

205
00:34:04,133 --> 00:34:06,824
Please! For fuck's sake!

206
00:34:07,394 --> 00:34:09,655
- Selena!
- (screams)

207
00:34:11,345 --> 00:34:14,736
Down the corridor. Flat 157. Move!

208
00:34:14,826 --> 00:34:16,917
Thank you. Thank you.

209
00:34:29,400 --> 00:34:31,440
Open the door!

210
00:34:37,012 --> 00:34:38,612
Open the door!

211
00:34:43,314 --> 00:34:45,794
- Open up!
- Where's Dad?

212
00:34:45,924 --> 00:34:47,355
What?

213
00:34:49,965 --> 00:34:52,966
- Open the fucking door!
- Where's Dad?

214
00:34:53,056 --> 00:34:55,317
Let them in, Hannah. Let them inside.

215
00:35:03,279 --> 00:35:05,539
Go in. Go in!

216
00:35:07,190 --> 00:35:10,191
( ''Frosty the Snowman'")

217
00:35:23,584 --> 00:35:26,025
So, l'm Frank, anyway.

218
00:35:26,105 --> 00:35:27,885
Jim.

219
00:35:28,715 --> 00:35:31,806
- Selena.
- Selena. Good to meet you.

220
00:35:31,886 --> 00:35:34,197
This is my daughter Hannah.

221
00:35:34,287 --> 00:35:36,547
Come on, sweetheart. Say hello.

222
00:35:37,938 --> 00:35:40,028
Come on.

223
00:35:40,809 --> 00:35:42,759
So...

224
00:35:42,849 --> 00:35:44,760
This is great. Just great.

225
00:35:47,070 --> 00:35:49,371
Calls for a celebration, l'd say.

226
00:35:49,461 --> 00:35:52,502
Why don't you all sit down and...

227
00:35:52,592 --> 00:35:55,552
Hannah, what have we got to offer?

228
00:35:55,632 --> 00:35:58,113
We've got Mum's creme de menthe.

229
00:35:58,243 --> 00:36:00,944
Great. Creme de menthe.

230
00:36:01,034 --> 00:36:03,724
Oh, yeah. Look, sit, please.

231
00:36:03,815 --> 00:36:06,295
Get comfortable.

232
00:36:09,116 --> 00:36:12,117
- (Frank) Where are the bloody glasses?
- Middle cupboard.

233
00:36:12,207 --> 00:36:15,077
Nah, the good ones. lt's a celebration.

234
00:36:15,167 --> 00:36:17,638
Top cupboard.

235
00:36:17,728 --> 00:36:20,469
So this is your place?

236
00:36:21,689 --> 00:36:23,470
lt's nice.

237
00:36:36,643 --> 00:36:37,733
There.

238
00:36:37,863 --> 00:36:40,954
l know it isn't much but, well, cheers.

239
00:36:41,044 --> 00:36:42,775
Cheers.

240
00:36:57,609 --> 00:36:59,609
(groans)

241
00:37:04,310 --> 00:37:06,351
You OK in there, Jim?

242
00:37:07,351 --> 00:37:09,652
Yeah.

243
00:37:09,742 --> 00:37:15,353
Sorry we couldn't spare the water.
Same with the toilet. The flush doesn't work.

244
00:37:17,004 --> 00:37:19,264
You'll have to use the bucket.

245
00:37:25,836 --> 00:37:28,447
Have to empty it each morning.

246
00:37:28,527 --> 00:37:32,188
Just chuck it over the balcony.
No mod cons here.

247
00:37:32,268 --> 00:37:33,968
lt's fine.

248
00:37:34,058 --> 00:37:37,189
Listen, it's late. We're gonna turn in.

249
00:37:38,879 --> 00:37:41,230
We have a spare room.

250
00:37:42,270 --> 00:37:43,581
ln there.

251
00:37:43,661 --> 00:37:45,621
Are you and Selena...?

252
00:37:46,881 --> 00:37:48,712
No. No, no, no.

253
00:37:48,792 --> 00:37:50,452
Um...

254
00:37:50,532 --> 00:37:52,923
l'll take the living room. lt's fine.

255
00:37:53,013 --> 00:37:54,883
Right.

256
00:37:55,754 --> 00:37:57,844
No, l mean, yeah.

257
00:37:58,885 --> 00:38:00,885
So, um...

258
00:38:01,925 --> 00:38:04,926
- Goodnight, then.
- Yeah. Goodnight, Frank.

259
00:38:19,590 --> 00:38:21,110
Very spruce.

260
00:38:22,461 --> 00:38:25,281
- Very shredded.
- Yeah.

261
00:38:29,633 --> 00:38:33,334
- So what do you make of them?
- Well, they're desperate.

262
00:38:34,464 --> 00:38:37,285
Probably need us more than we need them.

263
00:38:38,765 --> 00:38:40,986
l think they're good people.

264
00:38:43,856 --> 00:38:46,807
- Good people?
- Yeah.

265
00:38:48,598 --> 00:38:53,249
You should be more concerned about
whether they're gonna slow you down.

266
00:38:53,379 --> 00:38:57,120
- Because if they slowed you down...
- l'd leave them behind.

267
00:38:57,210 --> 00:38:59,120
- ln a heartbeat.
- Yeah.

268
00:38:59,810 --> 00:39:01,471
l wouldn't.

269
00:39:01,601 --> 00:39:05,122
Then you're gonna wind up
getting yourself killed.

270
00:39:13,474 --> 00:39:15,945
l'm gonna get some sleep.

271
00:39:18,475 --> 00:39:20,346
Selena...

272
00:39:21,166 --> 00:39:24,427
You think l don't get it, but l do get it.

273
00:39:26,297 --> 00:39:30,298
And l know l'd be dead already
if l hadn't met you.

274
00:39:30,819 --> 00:39:32,389
Sure.

275
00:39:32,479 --> 00:39:34,039
No, look...

276
00:39:36,430 --> 00:39:38,521
l mean, thank you.

277
00:39:41,691 --> 00:39:43,872
And l mean, sure.

278
00:39:43,952 --> 00:39:46,743
Goodnight, Jim.

279
00:39:46,823 --> 00:39:48,913
Goodnight.

280
00:40:02,527 --> 00:40:04,567
We lost water pressure three weeks ago.

281
00:40:04,697 --> 00:40:08,788
l thought we'd be OK with the water
from the other flats. Cisterns and tanks.

282
00:40:08,878 --> 00:40:12,099
But it vanishes so quick
you wouldn't believe.

283
00:40:15,400 --> 00:40:17,101
You drink it,

284
00:40:17,181 --> 00:40:18,961
it evaporates,

285
00:40:19,051 --> 00:40:21,142
turns stagnant.

286
00:40:23,532 --> 00:40:25,623
They're all empty.

287
00:40:26,493 --> 00:40:28,494
Hasn't rained in ten days.

288
00:40:28,574 --> 00:40:32,835
You can set up a plastic sheet
to catch dew and condensation.

289
00:40:32,925 --> 00:40:36,666
Saw it on TV once, but l can't make it work.

290
00:40:38,016 --> 00:40:40,107
You'd never think it.

291
00:40:41,017 --> 00:40:43,968
Needing rain so badly.

292
00:40:45,628 --> 00:40:48,059
Not in fucking England!

293
00:40:52,710 --> 00:40:55,841
Jim, we're not going to be able to stay here.

294
00:41:04,803 --> 00:41:08,544
- There's been no broadcasts for weeks.
- Just listen.

295
00:41:08,634 --> 00:41:13,195
(man on radio) Salvation is here.
The answer to lnfection is here.

296
00:41:13,285 --> 00:41:16,286
if you can hear this, you're not alone.

297
00:41:16,376 --> 00:41:20,897
There are others like you.
There are other survivors.

298
00:41:20,977 --> 00:41:23,158
We are soldiers and we are armed.

299
00:41:23,248 --> 00:41:26,549
Oh, my God. Soldiers.

300
00:41:26,639 --> 00:41:31,200
- Quiet. There's more.
- Our location is the 42nd blockade, M602,

301
00:41:31,330 --> 00:41:34,721
27 miles northeast of Manchester.

302
00:41:34,811 --> 00:41:38,722
- You must find us. Salvation is...
- Now itjust repeats.

303
00:41:38,812 --> 00:41:41,203
- lt's a recording?
- Yeah, it's a recording.

304
00:41:41,293 --> 00:41:44,203
But this is where it's telling us to go.

305
00:41:44,293 --> 00:41:46,424
Just there.

306
00:41:47,944 --> 00:41:52,726
The way things are, we might need
two or three days to get up there.

307
00:41:52,816 --> 00:41:54,556
''We''?

308
00:41:58,647 --> 00:42:04,729
Sound carries in this flat. Me and Hannah
do need you more than you need us.

309
00:42:04,819 --> 00:42:07,950
- Look, l didn't...
- No, it's OK. lt's the truth.

310
00:42:08,040 --> 00:42:10,560
l can't leave the block if it's the two of us.

311
00:42:10,650 --> 00:42:14,601
Something might happen to me.
Hannah'd be alone. l couldn't risk it.

312
00:42:14,691 --> 00:42:16,392
But with other people...

313
00:42:16,472 --> 00:42:20,783
lf it's a recording,
the soldiers who made it could be dead.

314
00:42:20,863 --> 00:42:24,344
- lt's possible.
- That stuff about the answer to lnfection...

315
00:42:24,434 --> 00:42:28,735
There is no answer!
lt's already done all the damage it can!

316
00:42:28,825 --> 00:42:31,656
- Maybe they have a cure.
- Maybe they've got nothing.

317
00:42:31,736 --> 00:42:35,827
- The only way to find out is to reach them.
- We could die trying, Frank!

318
00:42:37,917 --> 00:42:40,218
Or die here.

319
00:42:40,308 --> 00:42:45,999
And anyway, it isn't true what Dad said.
You need us just the same as we need you.

320
00:42:47,530 --> 00:42:49,400
We need each other.

321
00:42:49,480 --> 00:42:54,742
And we'll never be safe in the cities.
The soldiers could keep us safe.

322
00:42:55,482 --> 00:42:57,572
So we have to try and get there.

323
00:42:58,703 --> 00:43:00,273
Get there how?

324
00:43:11,706 --> 00:43:15,447
Just so you know,
l don't take cheques or credit cards.

325
00:43:44,015 --> 00:43:47,015
- (Frank) What do you think?
- lt's the most direct route.

326
00:43:47,105 --> 00:43:52,367
Then we should take the indirect route.
The one in daylight and not underground.

327
00:43:52,457 --> 00:43:54,757
(Frank) Let's just get it done.

328
00:44:07,721 --> 00:44:09,891
(Jim) No, no.

329
00:44:09,981 --> 00:44:12,462
No. See, this is a really shit idea.

330
00:44:13,332 --> 00:44:16,723
You know why?
Because it's obviously a shit idea.

331
00:44:16,813 --> 00:44:21,204
So we're gonna drive into the tunnel
full of fucking smashed cars...

332
00:44:21,294 --> 00:44:24,205
lt's really fucking obviously a shit idea!

333
00:44:24,295 --> 00:44:26,506
Hold on!

334
00:44:35,688 --> 00:44:37,599
Dad!

335
00:44:39,559 --> 00:44:41,730
(screaming and laughing)

336
00:44:57,034 --> 00:44:58,564
Fuck!

337
00:44:59,864 --> 00:45:02,255
The world's worst place to get a flat.

338
00:45:02,345 --> 00:45:05,696
Agreed. l think we'd better do this quick.

339
00:45:08,217 --> 00:45:10,347
l've got the wheel. You're on the jack.

340
00:45:24,961 --> 00:45:28,482
Do you hear that?
Hey, hey, do you hear that?

341
00:45:28,612 --> 00:45:30,652
Hear what?

342
00:45:31,353 --> 00:45:33,613
(Hannah) Right, l've done it.

343
00:45:35,224 --> 00:45:36,704
Dad?

344
00:45:36,784 --> 00:45:38,875
(scrabbling sounds)

345
00:45:40,575 --> 00:45:43,656
- Jesus Christ!
- (Hannah screaming)

346
00:45:43,746 --> 00:45:45,266
Fucking rats!

347
00:45:55,839 --> 00:45:58,400
They're running from the lnfected.

348
00:45:58,490 --> 00:46:00,400
Move it!

349
00:46:00,490 --> 00:46:04,791
Forget the jack, Hannah.
There's no time. Just lift, everyone.

350
00:46:04,881 --> 00:46:08,142
Grab hold! One, two, three, lift!

351
00:46:12,103 --> 00:46:14,054
Lift, lift!

352
00:46:14,584 --> 00:46:19,715
- (Selena) Don't look at them! Don't look!
- (Jim) l can see them! They're coming!

353
00:46:21,326 --> 00:46:23,406
(screeching)

354
00:46:25,457 --> 00:46:28,017
Come on, Hannah!

355
00:46:28,107 --> 00:46:30,498
Almost.

356
00:46:30,628 --> 00:46:33,539
- Get the tyre on, Hannah!
- l'm trying.

357
00:46:38,330 --> 00:46:40,981
Three, two, one,

358
00:46:41,061 --> 00:46:42,801
drop it!

359
00:46:46,932 --> 00:46:49,373
- Get in the car!
- Come on!

360
00:46:51,463 --> 00:46:53,854
- Frank, drive!
- Move it, Frank!

361
00:46:56,765 --> 00:46:58,855
(Jim) Whoo!

362
00:47:03,637 --> 00:47:05,727
Goodbye, you fuckers!

363
00:47:13,679 --> 00:47:15,990
Frank, stop the cab.

364
00:47:38,996 --> 00:47:41,256
Let's shop.

365
00:47:48,038 --> 00:47:50,259
(Frank making engine noises)

366
00:47:51,909 --> 00:47:53,390
You...

367
00:47:54,220 --> 00:47:55,690
You...

368
00:47:56,520 --> 00:47:57,611
You...

369
00:47:57,691 --> 00:48:00,261
(Jim) Anybody seen any buns?

370
00:48:00,391 --> 00:48:03,172
Hmm. lrradiated.

371
00:48:05,873 --> 00:48:09,434
Don't take anything
that needs to be cooked, OK?

372
00:48:09,564 --> 00:48:11,394
l think you can eat that raw.

373
00:48:11,484 --> 00:48:13,355
Decaffeinated coffee...

374
00:48:13,435 --> 00:48:15,485
Put that back.

375
00:48:16,696 --> 00:48:18,956
Can'tjust take any crap.

376
00:48:19,046 --> 00:48:23,568
lf l never see another chocolate bar again,
it'll be too soon.

377
00:48:23,958 --> 00:48:26,658
Not counting Terry's Chocolate Orange!

378
00:48:28,269 --> 00:48:31,880
Now, single malt,
16-year-old, dark, full flavour.

379
00:48:32,880 --> 00:48:34,830
Warm but not aggressive.

380
00:48:34,920 --> 00:48:38,401
- (Hannah and Selena laughing)
- Peaty aftertaste.

381
00:48:40,012 --> 00:48:43,233
Takes out the fire but leaves in the warmth.

382
00:49:38,157 --> 00:49:41,198
Either we do this now or we're walking.

383
00:49:48,250 --> 00:49:50,290
Not you.

384
00:49:53,641 --> 00:49:55,942
- Stay close, Jim.
- What?

385
00:49:56,032 --> 00:49:58,112
You heard.

386
00:50:24,689 --> 00:50:26,780
Where are you going?

387
00:50:27,860 --> 00:50:30,261
We've got enough food, Jim.

388
00:50:30,341 --> 00:50:32,691
We don't have any cheeseburgers.

389
00:50:33,431 --> 00:50:36,122
(quietly) Like going on holidays
with your aunt!

390
00:51:15,312 --> 00:51:17,793
Oh, Jesus.

391
00:51:43,580 --> 00:51:45,140
Hello?

392
00:51:58,934 --> 00:52:00,714
l hate you!

393
00:52:09,887 --> 00:52:11,977
Find anything?

394
00:52:14,238 --> 00:52:17,018
- Find anything, Jim?
- No! Let's get outta here.

395
00:52:17,108 --> 00:52:19,199
OK, we're done here.

396
00:52:21,420 --> 00:52:23,290
OK, Hannah.

397
00:52:30,682 --> 00:52:32,332
Easy. Brake!

398
00:52:32,422 --> 00:52:34,503
Brake, brake!

399
00:52:42,375 --> 00:52:44,426
Out.

400
00:53:29,037 --> 00:53:32,218
(Selena) Mmmm! Oh my God!

401
00:53:32,998 --> 00:53:35,999
l can, like, taste the vitamin C.

402
00:53:36,829 --> 00:53:39,610
Mmmm, the raisins are so moist.

403
00:53:40,830 --> 00:53:42,911
What did you say?

404
00:53:43,001 --> 00:53:45,782
The raisins. They're so moist.

405
00:53:50,573 --> 00:53:52,613
Look over here.

406
00:54:03,966 --> 00:54:05,787
Like a family.

407
00:54:05,877 --> 00:54:08,317
(Hannah) Do you think they're infected?

408
00:54:08,748 --> 00:54:10,838
(Frank) No.

409
00:54:14,269 --> 00:54:17,010
They're doing just fine.

410
00:54:22,751 --> 00:54:24,842
Come on. Let's eat!

411
00:54:39,536 --> 00:54:40,846
Know what l was thinking?

412
00:54:40,926 --> 00:54:44,627
That you'll never hear
another piece of original music again.

413
00:54:44,717 --> 00:54:48,888
You'll never read a book
that hasn't already been written,

414
00:54:49,928 --> 00:54:53,759
or see a film that hasn't already been shot.

415
00:54:58,280 --> 00:55:01,541
Um.... that's what you were thinking.

416
00:55:01,631 --> 00:55:03,502
No.

417
00:55:04,762 --> 00:55:07,023
l was thinking l was wrong.

418
00:55:08,283 --> 00:55:10,374
About what?

419
00:55:12,114 --> 00:55:14,155
All the death.

420
00:55:14,765 --> 00:55:16,855
All this shit.

421
00:55:18,466 --> 00:55:22,987
lt doesn't really mean anything
to Frank and Hannah because...

422
00:55:24,377 --> 00:55:27,808
Well, she's got her dad
and he's got his daughter. So...

423
00:55:27,898 --> 00:55:30,029
Cheeky monkey!

424
00:55:30,509 --> 00:55:34,120
l was wrong when l said
staying alive is as good as it gets.

425
00:55:37,731 --> 00:55:40,251
See, that's what l was thinking.

426
00:55:40,732 --> 00:55:42,422
Was it?

427
00:55:42,512 --> 00:55:44,773
Mm. You stole my thought.

428
00:55:49,994 --> 00:55:51,864
Sorry.

429
00:55:52,865 --> 00:55:54,735
That's OK.

430
00:55:54,815 --> 00:55:56,866
You can keep it.

431
00:55:58,036 --> 00:56:01,997
lt's getting late.
We'd better stay here for the night.

432
00:56:17,081 --> 00:56:19,612
l can't sleep.

433
00:56:19,692 --> 00:56:22,352
Me neither.

434
00:56:22,432 --> 00:56:24,783
Doesn't feel safe, does it?

435
00:56:24,873 --> 00:56:26,954
Outside like this.

436
00:56:27,824 --> 00:56:30,264
l think we're safe enough.

437
00:56:30,355 --> 00:56:33,005
Selena didn't seem to have any trouble.

438
00:56:33,695 --> 00:56:36,216
Yeah, l noticed that.

439
00:56:36,306 --> 00:56:37,786
Hey, Selena...

440
00:56:37,876 --> 00:56:39,957
What? What is it?

441
00:56:41,307 --> 00:56:43,358
How'd you get to sleep?

442
00:56:49,830 --> 00:56:53,701
Bloody hell. Must've needed
a hell of a prescription for that lot.

443
00:56:53,791 --> 00:56:58,092
l didn't need a prescription.
l qualified as a chemist.

444
00:56:58,142 --> 00:57:00,702
Oh, great. Valium.

445
00:57:00,792 --> 00:57:03,363
Not only will we be able to get to sleep

446
00:57:03,443 --> 00:57:07,144
but if we're attacked in the middle
of the night, we won't even care.

447
00:57:07,274 --> 00:57:09,495
- Two each.
- Not for me, thanks.

448
00:57:09,575 --> 00:57:11,625
Can l, Dad?

449
00:57:11,705 --> 00:57:13,706
l don't think so, sweetheart.

450
00:57:13,796 --> 00:57:15,276
Please?

451
00:57:16,797 --> 00:57:18,887
- No.
- l can't sleep.

452
00:57:21,968 --> 00:57:24,669
Come on, Frank. Let her live a little.

453
00:57:25,759 --> 00:57:29,760
- Give her half of one.
- All right. We're on.

454
00:57:40,453 --> 00:57:42,413
Night-night.

455
00:57:43,194 --> 00:57:45,844
You're a big softie, Frank.

456
00:58:16,462 --> 00:58:18,423
Frank?

457
00:58:18,513 --> 00:58:20,553
Hannah?

458
00:58:20,643 --> 00:58:22,554
Frank?

459
00:58:28,165 --> 00:58:30,246
Hello? Hello!

460
00:58:31,296 --> 00:58:32,556
Hello!

461
00:58:32,646 --> 00:58:35,117
Hello! Hello!

462
00:58:40,078 --> 00:58:42,169
(mumbles)

463
00:58:43,209 --> 00:58:45,300
Shh...

464
00:58:46,690 --> 00:58:49,471
You're having a bad dream, that's all.

465
00:58:52,212 --> 00:58:54,302
Thanks, Dad.

466
00:59:25,180 --> 00:59:27,311
(car horn)

467
00:59:29,611 --> 00:59:32,182
Come on, sleepyhead.

468
00:59:35,873 --> 00:59:37,923
Come on, Babe Ruth.

469
00:59:41,134 --> 00:59:43,055
(Frank) Hurry up.

470
00:59:44,795 --> 00:59:48,266
- Did l miss breakfast?
- (Selena) You'll sleep through anything.

471
00:59:48,356 --> 00:59:53,357
- (Jim) Did you have a fry-up?
- (Frank) We'll stop at a pub on the way. Door!

472
01:00:17,934 --> 01:00:22,455
(radio) Our location
is the 42nd blockade, the M602,

473
01:00:22,545 --> 01:00:25,626
27 miles northeast of Manchester.

474
01:00:25,716 --> 01:00:27,626
You must find us. Please!

475
01:00:27,716 --> 01:00:29,847
Salvation is here.

476
01:00:29,937 --> 01:00:32,938
The answer to lnfection is here.

477
01:01:04,986 --> 01:01:07,077
Must be Manchester.

478
01:01:09,287 --> 01:01:12,638
The whole of Manchester, the whole city.

479
01:01:14,509 --> 01:01:16,819
No fire crews to put it out.

480
01:02:11,654 --> 01:02:14,224
42nd blockade.

481
01:02:14,304 --> 01:02:16,655
This is it.

482
01:03:27,803 --> 01:03:31,804
l don't understand, Dad.
Did they leave?

483
01:03:31,894 --> 01:03:35,025
- l don't like this. l think we should go.
- No!

484
01:03:41,857 --> 01:03:46,678
Vehicles. We should check the vehicles.
There has to be something.

485
01:04:04,863 --> 01:04:06,734
Nothing.

486
01:04:06,864 --> 01:04:08,734
l can't believe it.

487
01:04:08,864 --> 01:04:10,815
Frank...

488
01:04:11,255 --> 01:04:13,125
Frank!

489
01:04:15,336 --> 01:04:16,996
- We have to go.
- Yeah.

490
01:04:17,126 --> 01:04:19,607
Go fucking where?!

491
01:04:52,435 --> 01:04:54,656
(cawing)

492
01:04:58,747 --> 01:05:00,878
Get out of it.

493
01:05:04,399 --> 01:05:06,489
Get out of it!

494
01:05:24,314 --> 01:05:26,884
Dad, are you all right?

495
01:05:26,964 --> 01:05:29,625
Yeah, l'm fine, sweetheart.

496
01:05:30,535 --> 01:05:33,276
Sorry l lost my temper.

497
01:05:33,356 --> 01:05:35,447
Hannah...

498
01:05:35,537 --> 01:05:38,498
l love you very much.

499
01:05:38,578 --> 01:05:40,578
- What?
- Keep away from me.

500
01:05:40,668 --> 01:05:43,019
Stay where you are.

501
01:05:43,099 --> 01:05:46,019
- Dad?
- Keep away from me! Keep away from me!

502
01:05:46,099 --> 01:05:48,580
Keep away! Keep away! Keep away!

503
01:05:48,710 --> 01:05:51,801
- Dad!
- Keep away! Keep away!

504
01:05:53,321 --> 01:05:56,062
(Hannah) What's wrong? Dad!

505
01:06:00,363 --> 01:06:02,764
Jim! Jim, he's infected!

506
01:06:02,894 --> 01:06:05,505
- No!
- Now, Jim! Now!

507
01:06:05,585 --> 01:06:09,025
- Jim, kill him! Jim!
- Dad!

508
01:06:09,105 --> 01:06:10,366
Kill him!

509
01:06:18,848 --> 01:06:21,159
Stay away from him!

510
01:06:22,369 --> 01:06:24,810
Keep away from the body!

511
01:06:27,550 --> 01:06:29,461
Dad?

512
01:06:51,857 --> 01:06:54,517
(man) Three survivors. One male, two female.

513
01:06:54,597 --> 01:06:57,948
l repeat, one male, two female.

514
01:06:58,038 --> 01:07:00,599
ETA, 15.

515
01:07:00,689 --> 01:07:03,120
Put the kettle on.

516
01:07:51,092 --> 01:07:53,613
l'm Major Henry West.

517
01:07:54,873 --> 01:07:56,574
- Welcome.
- Jim.

518
01:07:56,664 --> 01:07:58,664
Hello, Jim.

519
01:07:58,744 --> 01:08:00,485
Hello.

520
01:08:02,745 --> 01:08:07,616
Well, we've got beds with clean sheets
and a boiler that produces hot water.

521
01:08:07,706 --> 01:08:10,097
So you can all have a shower.

522
01:08:10,227 --> 01:08:13,538
You look like you need one. Please.

523
01:08:33,493 --> 01:08:38,715

Girls,

keep an eye on him, will ya?

Those pills,
